findChar.optionLabel: find something in a specific index
findChar.selectedLabel: I have an index and want to find

findIndex.optionLabel: find where is a specific text in the string
findIndex.selectedLabel: I have a text and want to find out

chatAt.optionLabel: a character in a given index
chatAt.description: Returns a single character in a given index of the string.
chatAt.example:
const paragraph = 'Code is poetry';
const index = 2;
console.log(`The character at index ${index} is ${paragraph.charAt(index)}`);

charCodeAt.optionLabel: a character code in a given index
charCodeAt.description: Returns the character UTF-16 code identifier between 0 and 65535 in a given index of the string.
charCodeAt.example:
const paragraph = 'Code is poetry';
const index = 2;
const code = paragraph.charCodeAt(index);
console.log(`The code ${code} is equal to the character ${paragraph.charAt(index)}`);
charCodeAt.output: "The code 100 is equal to the character d"

indexOf.optionLabel: where is the first occurrence of a text
indexOf.description: Returns the index of the first occurrence a given text in the string.
indexOf.example:
const paragraph = 'Code is poetry';
console.log(`The index of 'o' is ${paragraph.indexOf('o')}`);

lastIndexOf.optionLabel: where is the last occurrence of a text
lastIndexOf.description: Returns the index of the last occurrence a given text in the string.
lastIndexOf.example:
const paragraph = 'Code is poetry';
console.log(`The last index of 'o' is ${paragraph.lastIndexOf('o')}`);

search.optionLabel: where is the first occurrence of a regular expression
search.description: Returns the character UTF-16 code identifier in a given index of the string.
search.example:
const paragraph = 'Code is poetry';
const index = 2;
const code = paragraph.charCodeAt(index);
console.log(`The character code ${code} is equal to ${paragraph.charAt(index)}`);
search.output: "The character code 100 is equal to d"

startsWith.optionLabel: if a string starts with specific characters
startsWith.description: Returns true or false if the string starts with given characters.
startsWith.example:
const paragraph = 'Code is poetry';
console.log(`Starts with Code? ${paragraph.startsWith('Code')}`);
console.log(`Starts with Poetry? ${paragraph.startsWith('Poetry')}`);
startsWith.output:
"Starts with Code? true
Starts with Poetry? false"

endstWith.optionLabel: if a string ends with specific characters
endstWith.description: Returns true or false if the string ends with given characters.
endstWith.example:
const paragraph = 'Code is poetry';
console.log(`Ends with code? ${paragraph.endsWith('code')}`);
console.log(`Ends with poetry? ${paragraph.startsWith('poetry')}`);
endstWith.output:
"Ends with code? false
Ends with poetry? false"

concat.optionLabel: one or more texts to a string
concat.description: Returns a new string with the original string concatenated with the given texts.

repeat.description: Returns a new string with the original text repeated a given number of times.

padStart.optionLabel: the same text repeated at the beginning of a string
padStart.description: Returns a new string filled with the same text at the beginning of the string until it reaches a given length.

padEnd.optionLabel: the same text repeated at the end of a string
padEnd.description: Returns a new string filled with the same text at the end of the string until it reaches a given length.

trim.description: Returns a new string with all the whitespaces removed.

trimStart.optionLabel: whitespaces from the beginning of a string
trimStart.description: Returns a new string with all the whitespaces removed from the beginning of the string.

trimEnd.optionLabel: whitespaces from the end of a string
trimEnd.description: Returns a new string with all the whitespaces removed from the end of the string.

replace.optionLabel: the first match of a text or regular expression
replace.description: Returns a new string with the first match of a text or regular expression replaced by another given text. This method can also be used to remove the match by replacing it with an empty string

replaceAll.optionLabel: all matches of a text or regular expression
replaceAll.description: Returns a new string with all matches of a text or regular expression replaced by another given text. This method can also be used to remove all matches by replacing them with an empty string.

replace.optionLabel: the first match of a text or regular expression
replace.description: Returns a new string with the first match of a text or regular expression replaced by another given text.

replaceAll.optionLabel: all matches of a text or regular expression
replaceAll.description: Returns a new string with all matches of a text or regular expression replaced by another given text.

match.optionLabel: all matches of a regular expression
match.description: Returns an array with all matches of a regular expression in a string.

matchAll.optionLabel: all matches of a regular expression, including capturing groups
matchAll.description: Returns an iterator with all matches of a regular expression in a string, including capturing groups.

slice.optionLabel: a section of the string starting at a given index
slice.description: Returns a new string with all the text between the given indexes.

substring.optionLabel: a section of the string between two indexes
substring.description: Returns a new string with all the text between the two given indexes.

split.optionLabel: divide the string with a given separator
split.description: Returns a list of substrings found between a given separator.

toUpperCase.description: Returns a new string with all text converted to uppercase.

toLowerCase.description: Returns a new string with all text converted to lowercase.
